summary: This document is an email chain from September 19, 2008, regarding a journalist's inquiry about the federal non-prosecution agreement for Jeffrey Epstein. The journalist seeks comment from the Assistant U.S. Attorney who handled the case, but the AUSA and another official indicate they will not comment.

persons.name: Michele Dargan
persons.context: Journalist from the Palm Beach Daily News working on a story about the federal non-prosecution agreement for Jeffrey Epstein. She is seeking comment from the AUSA on the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the journalist's story regarding his federal non-prosecution agreement and state plea agreement.

events.title: Journalist inquiry about Epstein non-prosecution
events.description: Michele Dargan, a staff writer, contacts the U.S. Attorney's Office seeking comment on why the office decided not to federally prosecute Jeffrey Epstein, referencing his non-prosecution agreement.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: A journalist is investigating the federal non-prosecution agreement that was part of Jeffrey Epstein's state plea agreement in 2008.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) who handled the Epstein case is referenced, but her name is redacted in the text.
Officials from the U.S. Attorney's Office indicate they will provide 'no comment' in response to the press inquiry about the decision not to prosecute Epstein federally.
The document shows media scrutiny of the Epstein plea deal shortly after it was finalized.
The correspondence reveals the U.S. Attorney's Office's reluctance to publicly discuss the Epstein case at that time.
